definitions: in a manner characterized by constant change, activity, or progress

examples.text: this situation can change dynamically on the timescale of minutes
plants must respond dynamically to environmental changes

shortDefinitions: in manner characterized by constant change or progress

definitions: in a way that relates to motion

examples.text: these bones act dynamically to allow oppositional grip

shortDefinitions: in way that relates to motion

definitions: used in relation to web pages that update frequently or are generated according to an individual's search terms

examples.text: dynamically linked versions of the browser

shortDefinitions: used in relation to web pages that update frequently or are generated according to individual's search terms

definitions: in a positive, energetic, and innovative manner

examples.text: innovative openings were often dynamically charged
the chairman will continue to act dynamically

shortDefinitions: in positive, energetic, and innovative manner

definitions: in a way that relates to the volume of sound produced by an instrument, voice, or recording

examples.text: the stereo mix is clearer and more dynamically sound

shortDefinitions: in way that relates to volume of sound produced by instrument or recording
